meanings.definition: The action of compiling or putting together again.
meanings.sent1: The recompilation of the report took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: The recompilation of the old photos into a new album brought back memories.
meanings.sent3: After the computer crashed, the recompilation of all the files became a tedious task.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a recompilation of memories, each one carefully stored and organized.
meanings.sent5: The recompilation of ingredients in the recipe resulted in a delicious dish.

meanings.definition: The process of reassembling or reconstructing something.
meanings.sent1: The recompilation of the broken toy was a fun project for the kids.
meanings.sent2: The recompilation of the jigsaw puzzle required patience and attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: Watching the robot do the recompilation dance was both amusing and impressive.
meanings.sent4: The recompilation of the team after a defeat led to a stronger bond among the players.
meanings.sent5: The recompilation of the scattered papers on the desk made it look neat and organized.

meanings.definition: The act of gathering or collecting information or data again.
meanings.sent1: The recompilation of data for the research project was time-consuming.
meanings.sent2: The recompilation of historical records shed new light on the event.
meanings.sent3: The detective's recompilation of clues led to the surprising discovery of the culprit.
meanings.sent4: Her recompilation of recipes from different sources created a unique cookbook.
meanings.sent5: The recompilation of evidence in the case pointed towards a different suspect.
